reviews.text: Absolutely amazing hot brown! Best I've ever had. The service was attentive without being overbearing. The atmosphere is classic Louisville - intimate, sophisticated, and warm. Will definitely return.
reviews.author: Sarah M.

reviews.text: Food was excellent, but we waited 45 minutes for a table despite having a reservation. Once seated, everything was perfect. The bourbon selection is outstanding.
reviews.author: John D.

reviews.text: This place never disappoints. Been coming for years and the quality is always consistent. The shrimp and grits are phenomenal. Staff remembers regular customers.
reviews.author: Michael R.

reviews.text: Overpriced for what you get. Food was good but not exceptional. Service was slow on a busy Saturday night. Expected more given the reputation.
reviews.author: Jennifer L.

reviews.text: Perfect for a special occasion. The jazz music adds to the ambiance. Had the duck breast and it was cooked to perfection. Wine list is impressive.
reviews.author: David K.

reviews.text: Great food and atmosphere but parking can be challenging. The fried chicken is crispy and flavorful. Cocktails are well-crafted. A Louisville institution.
reviews.author: Lisa P.

reviews.text: Took clients here for dinner and they were blown away. Professional service, excellent food, and the historic building adds character. Highly recommend.
reviews.author: Robert T.

reviews.text: Disappointing experience. Entree came out cold and we had to send it back. Manager comped the dish but the damage was done. Not sure I'll return.
reviews.author: Amanda S.

reviews.text: The best restaurant in Louisville, hands down. Every dish is thoughtfully prepared. The Derby pie dessert is a must-try. Service is impeccable.
reviews.author: Charles W.

reviews.text: Solid upscale dining experience. The menu changes seasonally which keeps things interesting. Portions are generous. Can get loud when crowded.
reviews.author: Emily B.

reviews.text: Celebrated our anniversary here and it was magical. The staff went above and beyond with a complimentary dessert and handwritten note. Food was outstanding.
reviews.author: Mark and Jessica H.

reviews.text: Great atmosphere with live jazz on weekends. The catfish was perfectly seasoned. Service could be a bit faster but overall a very good experience.
reviews.author: Thomas G.

reviews.text: Nice place but felt rushed. They seemed to want to turn the table quickly. Food was good but not worth the premium prices in my opinion.
reviews.author: Nicole F.

reviews.text: Everything about this place is top-notch. From the moment you walk in, you feel welcomed. The seafood gumbo is incredible. Best restaurant in the Highlands.
reviews.author: William C.

reviews.text: Very good food and service. The ribeye was cooked exactly as ordered. Noise level is high during peak hours. Make a reservation well in advance.
reviews.author: Patricia M.

reviews.text: An absolute gem. The chef clearly takes pride in every dish. Had the quail and it was phenomenal. The bourbon butter sauce is divine.
reviews.author: Gregory N.

reviews.text: Excellent food and historic charm. The only downside is limited parking. Try the pork chop - it's huge and delicious. Service was friendly and knowledgeable.
reviews.author: Samantha V.

reviews.text: If you're visiting Louisville, you MUST eat here. Authentic Southern cuisine done right. The fried green tomatoes are a perfect starter.
reviews.author: Kevin O.

reviews.text: Good but not great. Expected more based on reviews. Entree was underseasoned. Dessert saved the meal. Might give it another try.
reviews.author: Rachel D.

reviews.text: Consistently excellent. Been a regular for over a decade. The menu evolves but the quality never wavers. Staff treats you like family.
reviews.author: James and Carol B.
